org.jcaki
Class SimpleTextReader

java.lang.Object
  org.jcaki.SimpleTextReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable
public final class SimpleTextReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable

SimpleTextReader can be used reading text sources with ease.

asStringList

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> asStringList()
                                              throws java.io.IOException
Reads a reader as a list of strings. each item represents one line in the reader.

Returns:
a list of Strings from the reader.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an io error occurs

getIterableReader

public IterableLineReader getIterableReader()
                                     throws java.io.IOException
returns an IterableLineReader. This is expecially useful to use in enhanced for loops. if all the elements are consumed, the resources will be closed automatically. However, it is suggested to close the IterableLineReader explicitly in a try-finally block using IOs.closeSilently(java.io.Closeable...) method.

Returns:
a new IterableLineReader instance.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if file does not exist, or encoding is not supported.

getLineIterator

public LineIterator getLineIterator()
                             throws java.io.IOException
returns a LineIterator. it is suggested to close th iterator in a finally block.

Returns:
an IterableLineReader that can be iterated for lines.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if file does not exist, or encoding is not supported.

countLines

public long countLines()
                throws java.io.IOException
counts the lines. if filters are used, it counts ONLY the lines that is passed from the filters.

Returns:
line count.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem while accesing the file.

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Closes the stream silently.
